revised_title: Accommodation Coefficient of Neon and Tungsten: Theoretical and Experimental Analysis
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to measure the accommodation coefficient of neon gas on a tungsten surface. They found that the coefficient was 0.07 at 295K and analyzed the effect of repulsive and attractive forces between gas atoms and the solid surface. The results provide insights into the behavior of gas atoms and the potential energy between them and solid surfaces.
